metadata.titleEn: 30km Gridded dataset of Snowline altitude in High Mountain Asia （2001-2019）
metadata.titleCn: 亚洲高山区30km格网雪线高度数据集（2001-2019）
metadata.description: High Mountain Asia is the third largest cryosphere on earth other than the Antarctic and Arctic regions. The  large amounts of glaciers and snow over the High Mountain Asia play an important role not only on global water cycle but also on water resources and ecology of the arid regions of central Asia. The snowline, as the lower boundary of the snow covered area at the end of melting season, its altitude changes can directly reflect the changes in snow and glaciers. The snowline altitude provides a possibility to rapidly obtain a proxy for their equilibrium line altitude (ELA) which in turn is an indicator for the glacier mass balance. In this dataset, the daily MODIS snow cover products from 2001 to 2019 are used as the main data source. The cloud removal of the daily MODIS snow cover products was firstly carried out based on the developed cubic spline interpolation cloud-removel method, and snow covered days (SCD) are extracted using the cloud-removed MODIS snow cover products. In addition, the MODIS SCD threshold for estimating perennial snow cover is calibrated using the observed data of glacier annual mass balance and Landsat data at the end of melting season. The altitude value of the snowline at the end of melting season is determined by combining the perennial snow cover area and the hypsometric (area-elevation) curve.  Finally, the 30km gridded dataset of snowline altitude in the High Mountain Asia during 2001-2019 is generated. This dataset can provide data support for the study of cryosphere and climate change over the High Mountain Asia.
metadata.descriptionCn: 亚洲高山区是地球上除南极和北极地区之外的第三大冰冻圈，分布着大量冰川积雪，不仅对全球水循环而且对亚洲中部干旱区的水资源及生态环境均有举足轻重的影响。在冰川学中，雪线作为消融期末积雪存在的下限，其高度变化信息是冰雪水资源变化的直观反映，也常用于指示冰川物质平衡，直接反映着冰川的进退。本数据集以2001—2019年逐日MODIS积雪产品为主要数据源，首先对逐日的MODIS积雪覆盖率产品进行去云处理，获得积雪覆盖日数（SCD）数据集；并用冰川年物质平衡观测数据、融雪末期Landsat数据对提取终年积雪的MODIS SCD阈值进行率定；然后以MODIS SCD提取的终年积雪面积结合地形“面积—高程”曲线实现大尺度融雪末期雪线高度信息的提取，最后得到2001-2019年亚洲高山区30km格网雪线高度数据集。本数据集可为亚洲高山区冰冻圈及气候变化等相关研究提供数据支持。
metadata.instructions:
Named HMA_ Snowline Altitude_ 30 km_Grid, expressed as the 30 km grid snowline altitude dataset in the High Mountain Asia.
The data format is. shp, which can be opened by ArcGIS software；the fields in the data property table (2001, 2002,...2019) respectively correspond to the snowline altitude of each year from 2001 to 2019；A value of 0 represents none snowline altitude.
metadata.instructionsCn:
命名为HMA_ Snowline Altitude_30km_Grid，表示为亚洲高山区30km格网雪线高度数据集.

background: In the context of global climate change, the cryosphere's components have become a focal point of global change research, with snow being the most active component of the cryosphere, playing an important role in the global energy and water cycle due to its high albedo, high phase change latent heat, and low thermal conductivity. In hydrological and remote sensing research, the snowline is defined as the boundary line between snow-covered and snow-free areas, also known as the transient snowline. The snowline at the end of the ablation season is also commonly referred to as the snowline at the end of the melting season. In glacier and climate change research, the snowline refers to the zero balance line between annual snowfall and ablation, equivalent to the snowline at the end of the melting season. The altitude of the snowline at the end of the ablation season is considered an approximate value of the glacier mass balance line altitude and can indicate the annual mass balance of glaciers, serving as a sensitive indicator of climate change. High Mountain Asia, also known as Central Asia, is the third largest cryosphere in the world outside the polar regions and has the largest snow-covered area in the mid-latitudes, with its extensive glacier and snow distribution significantly impacting atmospheric circulation, water cycles, and radiation balance in Asia and even globally.
research objective: Using the High Mountain Asia as the study area and the developed snowline altitude dataset at a 30 km grid scale (744 grids) for the end of the ablation season, this study aims to quantitatively analyze the spatial differences in snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season in High Mountain Asia and its influencing factors. The study seeks to analyze the spatial heterogeneity of snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season in High Mountain Asia at a 30 km scale using a variogram model and to analyze the influencing factors of spatial differences in snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season in High Mountain Asia from two aspects: (1) fitting the snowline altitude of the entire High Mountain Asia and six sub-regions with three variables: latitude, longitude, and altitude; (2) exploring the impact of climatic factors (temperature, precipitation, radiation) on the spatial differences of interannual variation in snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season in High Mountain Asia and quantitatively analyzing its dominant factors.
challenges: The spatial heterogeneity of snowline altitude in High Mountain Asia is particularly strong due to the influence of complex topography. Therefore, it is necessary and urgent to quantitatively analyze the spatial dependency characteristics and influencing factors of snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season in High Mountain Asia, which can provide a basis for studying the mechanisms of cryosphere changes.
methods: In this study, the snowline altitude data at the end of the ablation season in High Mountain Asia from 2001 to 2016 was used. The entire High Mountain Asia glacier area was divided into 744 grids of 30 km × 30 km, and the snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season for each grid from 2001 to 2016 was extracted from the MODIS snow cover product. The extraction method first cloud-cleared the daily MODIS snow cover fraction product to obtain the snow cover days (SCD) dataset; then, the MODIS SCD threshold for extracting perennial snow was calibrated using glacier annual mass balance observation data and melting season Landsat data; finally, for any glacier grid, the snowline altitude information at the end of the ablation season was extracted at a large scale by combining the perennial snow area extracted by MODIS SCD with the "area-elevation" curve of the terrain.
dataset: The dataset used in this study is the snowline altitude data at the end of the ablation season in High Mountain Asia (2001-2016). In this dataset, the entire High Mountain Asia glacier area is divided into 744 grids of 30 km × 30 km, and the snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season for each grid from 2001 to 2016 is extracted from the MODIS snow cover product.
findings: The spatial distribution of snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season in High Mountain Asia shows distinct spatial heterogeneity. The snowline altitude in the inner Tibet Plateau is relatively high (5,967 m a.s.l.) and shows a small gradient of spatial variation; the lower values of snowline altitude (< 4,500 m) appear in the northern regions of High Mountain Asia (the Altay Mts. and the Tianshan Mts.); the contour lines of snowline altitude are the densest in the west of High Mountain Asia. The relative contribution ratios of the influences of latitude, longitude, and altitude on snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season are 60.5%, 2.6%, and 36.9%, respectively, and the relative contribution ratios vary for different sub-regions. Summer mean air temperature is the dominant factor affecting the snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season in High Mountain Asia, and 45.6% of the grids are influenced by summer mean air temperature and distributed in all the subregions; the grids mainly affected by annual precipitation account for about 18%, which are mainly distributed in the Karakoram Mountains and Pamir; only 10% of the grids are mainly affected by annual radiation (upward long wave flux at ground surface).
backgroundCn: 在全球气候变化的背景下，冰冻圈的各个组成部分已成为全球变化研究的焦点，其中雪是冰冻圈中最活跃的组成部分，因其高反照率、高相变潜热和低导热性在全球能量和水循环中发挥着重要作用。在水文和遥感研究中，雪线被定义为雪覆盖区域与无雪区域之间的边界线，也称为瞬时雪线。融化季节结束时的雪线通常被称为融化季节结束时的雪线。在冰川和气候变化研究中，雪线指的是年降雪量与消融量之间的零平衡线，相当于融化季节结束时的雪线。融化季节结束时雪线的高度被视为冰川质量平衡线高度的近似值，并可以指示冰川的年质量平衡，作为气候变化的敏感指标。高山亚洲，也被称为中亚，是世界上第三大冰冻圈，位于极地地区之外，拥有中纬度地区最大的雪覆盖面积，其广泛的冰川和雪分布对亚洲乃至全球的大气环流、水循环和辐射平衡产生了显著影响。
research objectiveCn: 本研究以高山亚洲为研究区域，利用在消融季节结束时开发的30公里网格尺度（744个网格）雪线高度数据集，旨在定量分析高山亚洲消融季节结束时雪线高度的空间差异及其影响因素。研究将使用变异函数模型分析高山亚洲消融季节结束时雪线高度的空间异质性，并从两个方面分析高山亚洲消融季节结束时雪线高度空间差异的影响因素：（1）利用纬度、经度和海拔三个变量拟合整个高山亚洲及六个子区域的雪线高度；（2）探讨气候因素（温度、降水、辐射）对高山亚洲消融季节结束时雪线高度年际变化空间差异的影响，并定量分析其主导因素。
challengesCn: 高山亚洲的雪线高度空间异质性特别强，主要受到复杂地形的影响。因此，有必要和紧迫地定量分析高山亚洲融化季末雪线高度的空间依赖特征及其影响因素，这可以为研究冰冻圈变化机制提供基础。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，使用了2001年至2016年高山亚洲融化季节结束时的雪线高度数据。整个高山亚洲冰川区域被划分为744个30公里×30公里的网格，并从MODIS雪盖产品中提取了每个网格在2001年至2016年融化季节结束时的雪线高度。提取方法首先对每日MODIS雪盖比例产品进行了去云处理，以获得雪盖天数（SCD）数据集；然后，使用冰川年质量平衡观测数据和融化季节的Landsat数据对提取常年积雪的MODIS SCD阈值进行了校准；最后，对于任何冰川网格，通过将MODIS SCD提取的常年积雪面积与地形的“面积-海拔”曲线结合，提取了大规模的融化季节结束时的雪线高度信息。
datasetCn: 本研究使用的数据集是高山亚洲（2001-2016年）融化季节结束时的雪线高度数据。在该数据集中，高山亚洲的整个冰川区域被划分为744个30公里 × 30公里的网格，并从MODIS雪盖产品中提取了每个网格在2001年至2016年融化季节结束时的雪线高度。
findingsCn: 高山亚洲的雪线高度在消融季节结束时显示出明显的空间异质性。内藏区的雪线高度相对较高（5967米海拔），且空间变化梯度较小；而在高山亚洲的北部地区（阿尔泰山和天山），雪线高度较低（<4500米）；雪线高度的等高线在高山亚洲西部最为密集。纬度、经度和海拔对消融季节结束时雪线高度的影响相对贡献比为60.5%、2.6%和36.9%，且不同子区域的相对贡献比有所不同。夏季平均气温是影响高山亚洲消融季节结束时雪线高度的主导因素，受夏季平均气温影响的网格占比为45.6%，分布在所有子区域；主要受年降水量影响的网格约占18%，主要分布在喀喇昆仑山和帕米尔高原；而主要受年辐射（地表向上的长波辐射通量）影响的网格仅占10%。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to determine snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season in High Mountain Asia?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于确定高山亚洲融化季节结束时雪线高度的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: A data collection method used to determine snowline altitude involves cloud-clearing daily MODIS snow cover fraction products to obtain a snow cover days (SCD) dataset, calibrating the MODIS SCD threshold for extracting perennial snow using glacier annual mass balance observation data and melting season Landsat data, and combining the perennial snow area extracted by MODIS SCD with the 'area-elevation' curve of the terrain.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种用于确定雪线高度的数据收集方法涉及每日MODIS雪盖分数产品的云清除，以获得雪盖天数（SCD）数据集，利用冰川年际质量平衡观测数据和融化季节的Landsat数据对MODIS SCD阈值进行校准，并将MODIS SCD提取的常年积雪面积与地形的“面积-海拔”曲线结合起来。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of how spatial heterogeneity in snowline altitude is quantitatively analyzed in the context of High Mountain Asia?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否举例说明在高山亚洲的背景下，如何定量分析雪线高度的空间异质性？
Example.AnswerEn: Spatial heterogeneity in snowline altitude is analyzed using a variogram model to examine the spatial dependency characteristics of snowline altitude at a 30 km scale, fitting snowline altitude with variables such as latitude, longitude, and altitude, and exploring the impact of climatic factors like temperature, precipitation, and radiation on interannual variation in snowline altitude.
Example.AnswerCn: 通过变异函数模型分析雪线高度的空间异质性，以考察30公里尺度上雪线高度的空间依赖特征，利用纬度、经度和海拔等变量拟合雪线高度，并探讨气候因素如温度、降水和辐射对雪线高度年际变化的影响。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a dataset that could be used to study the snowline altitude in High Mountain Asia?
Example.QuestionCn: 一个可以用来研究高山亚洲雪线高度的数据集的例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A dataset used to study snowline altitude includes data from the MODIS snow cover product, where the entire High Mountain Asia glacier area is divided into 744 grids of 30 km × 30 km, with snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season extracted for each grid from 2001 to 2016.
Example.AnswerCn: 用于研究雪线高度的数据集包括来自MODIS雪盖产品的数据，其中整个高山亚洲冰川区域被划分为744个30公里 × 30公里的网格，2001年至2016年间从每个网格提取了消融季节结束时的雪线高度。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season' refer to in the context of cryosphere research?
Definition.QuestionCn: “融化季节结束时的雪线高度”在冰冻圈研究中指的是在夏季融化季节结束时，雪和冰的界限高度，即在该高度以上仍然存在雪或冰，而在该高度以下则完全融化。
Definition.AnswerEn: In cryosphere research, 'snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season' refers to the boundary between snow-covered and snow-free areas at the end of the melting season. It is considered an approximate value of the glacier mass balance line altitude and serves as a sensitive indicator of climate change, reflecting the balance between annual snowfall and ablation.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在冰冻圈研究中，“消融季节末的雪线高度”指的是在融化季节结束时，雪覆盖区域与无雪区域之间的边界。它被视为冰川质量平衡线高度的一个近似值，并作为气候变化的敏感指标，反映了年度降雪与消融之间的平衡。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In analyzing snowline altitude, how do the challenges related to spatial heterogeneity in High Mountain Asia differ from those in other cryosphere regions?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在分析雪线高度时，高山亚洲的空间异质性相关挑战与其他冰冻圈区域的挑战有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The spatial heterogeneity of snowline altitude in High Mountain Asia is particularly strong due to the influence of complex topography, making it necessary to analyze spatial dependency characteristics and influencing factors. This is a prominent challenge in High Mountain Asia, as it has extensive glacier and snow distribution impacting atmospheric circulation and the water cycle, which might differ from other cryosphere regions with less complex topographies or different climatic influences.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 高山亚洲的雪线高度空间异质性特别强，主要受到复杂地形的影响，因此有必要分析其空间依赖特征和影响因素。这在高山亚洲是一个显著的挑战，因为该地区广泛的冰川和雪分布影响着大气环流和水循环，这可能与其他地形较简单或气候影响不同的冰冻圈区域有所不同。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What can the spatial heterogeneity of snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season reveal about the environmental and climatic factors affecting High Mountain Asia?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在消融季节结束时，雪线高度的空间异质性可以揭示影响高山亚洲的环境和气候因素。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The spatial heterogeneity of snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season in High Mountain Asia indicates the influence of complex topography and climate conditions. It reveals that latitude, altitude, and climatic factors such as temperature, precipitation, and radiation significantly impact the snowline altitude. The variance in snowline altitude across different regions can provide insights into the mechanisms of cryosphere changes and the dominant climatic factors affecting these changes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 高山亚洲融雪季末雪线高度的空间异质性表明了复杂地形和气候条件的影响。它揭示了纬度、高度以及温度、降水和辐射等气候因素对雪线高度的显著影响。不同地区雪线高度的差异可以提供有关冰冻圈变化机制的见解，以及影响这些变化的主要气候因素。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the integration of MODIS snow cover data and glacier mass balance observations improve the accuracy of snowline altitude datasets?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: MODIS雪盖数据与冰川质量平衡观测的整合如何提高雪线高度数据集的准确性。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Integrating MODIS snow cover data with glacier mass balance observations can enhance the accuracy of snowline altitude datasets by allowing for calibration of the MODIS snow cover days (SCD) threshold used in extracting perennial snow. This integration helps in refining the extraction process of snowline altitude by providing a more precise delineation of the snow-covered areas, which in turn improves the reliability of the snowline altitude data at the end of the ablation season.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 将MODIS雪盖数据与冰川质量平衡观测数据相结合，可以通过校准用于提取常年积雪的MODIS雪盖天数（SCD）阈值，来提高雪线高度数据集的准确性。这种整合有助于优化雪线高度的提取过程，通过提供更精确的雪覆盖区域划分，从而提高了在消融季节结束时雪线高度数据的可靠性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What methodological approaches can be employed to address the challenges posed by the strong spatial heterogeneity of snowline altitude in High Mountain Asia?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以采用哪些方法论方法来应对高山亚洲雪线高度强空间异质性带来的挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: To address the challenges of strong spatial heterogeneity, methodological approaches such as using variogram models to analyze spatial dependency characteristics and incorporating multiple climatic and topographic variables can be employed. By fitting snowline altitude data with variables like latitude, longitude, altitude, and climatic factors, researchers can better understand the spatial differences and dominant factors influencing snowline altitude, which can provide a basis for studying cryosphere changes in High Mountain Asia.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 为了解决强空间异质性带来的挑战，可以采用一些方法论，如使用变异函数模型分析空间依赖特征，并结合多个气候和地形变量。通过将雪线高度数据与纬度、经度、高度和气候因素等变量进行拟合，研究人员可以更好地理解影响雪线高度的空间差异和主导因素，这为研究高山亚洲的冰冻圈变化提供了基础。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在高山亚洲，雪线高度的强空间异质性受哪些因素影响？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The strong spatial heterogeneity of snowline altitude in High Mountain Asia is influenced by the complex topography of the region. Additionally, climatic factors such as temperature, precipitation, and radiation also play a role in affecting the spatial differences of snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 高山亚洲雪线高度的强空间异质性受到该地区复杂地形的影响。此外，气候因素如温度、降水和辐射也在影响融化季末雪线高度的空间差异方面发挥了作用。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it necessary to calibrate the MODIS SCD threshold with glacier annual mass balance data and melting season Landsat data for snowline extraction?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么有必要使用冰川年际质量平衡数据和融化季节的Landsat数据来校准MODIS SCD阈值以提取雪线？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Calibration of the MODIS SCD threshold with glacier annual mass balance data and melting season Landsat data is necessary to accurately extract perennial snow, which helps in extracting snowline altitude information at a large scale. This calibration ensures that the snowline altitude data accurately reflects the actual conditions at the end of the ablation season.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 对MODIS SCD阈值进行校准与冰川年际质量平衡数据和融化季节的Landsat数据是必要的，以准确提取常年积雪，这有助于大规模提取雪线高度信息。此校准确保雪线高度数据准确反映融化季节结束时的实际情况。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What role does the integration of glacier annual mass balance data and melting season Landsat data play in the extraction and calibration of perennial snowline altitude datasets?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 冰川年质量平衡数据与融化季节的Landsat数据的整合在提取和校准常年雪线高度数据集中的作用是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating glacier annual mass balance data and melting season Landsat data helps calibrate the MODIS SCD threshold for extracting perennial snow, which is essential for accurately determining snowline altitude. This integration refines the dataset, ensuring the snowline altitude reflects true glacier mass balance and improves the understanding of spatial differences in snowline altitude across High Mountain Asia.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将冰川年度质量平衡数据与融化季节的Landsat数据相结合，有助于校准MODIS SCD阈值，以提取常年积雪，这对于准确确定雪线高度至关重要。这种整合精炼了数据集，确保雪线高度反映真实的冰川质量平衡，并改善了对高山亚洲雪线高度空间差异的理解。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the instrumental steps involved in calibrating the MODIS snow cover product for extracting perennial snow data in High Mountain Asia?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山亚洲提取常年雪数据时，校准MODIS雪盖产品的步骤包括以下几个方面：
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The calibration of the MODIS snow cover product for extracting perennial snow data involves cloud-clearing the daily MODIS snow cover fraction product to obtain the snow cover days (SCD) dataset. Then, the MODIS SCD threshold for extracting perennial snow is calibrated using glacier annual mass balance observation data and melting season Landsat data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: MODIS雪盖产品的校准用于提取常年雪数据，涉及对每日MODIS雪盖分数产品进行云清除，以获得雪盖天数（SCD）数据集。然后，使用冰川年质量平衡观测数据和融化季节的Landsat数据来校准提取常年雪的MODIS SCD阈值。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is the snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season extracted using a 30 km grid scale in High Mountain Asia?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何在高山亚洲使用30公里网格尺度提取融雪季末的雪线高度？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The extraction of snowline altitude at the end of the ablation season involves dividing the entire High Mountain Asia glacier area into 744 grids of 30 km × 30 km. The snowline altitude for each grid is extracted from the MODIS snow cover product, where the perennial snow area extracted by MODIS SCD is combined with the 'area-elevation' curve of the terrain to obtain the snowline altitude information at a large scale.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在融化季节结束时提取雪线高度涉及将整个高山亚洲冰川区域划分为744个30公里 × 30公里的网格。每个网格的雪线高度是从MODIS雪盖产品中提取的，其中MODIS SCD提取的常年雪区与地形的“面积-海拔”曲线相结合，以获得大规模的雪线高度信息。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural methods are used to analyze the spatial heterogeneity of snowline altitude in High Mountain Asia?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山亚洲分析雪线高度空间异质性使用了哪些程序方法？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To analyze the spatial heterogeneity of snowline altitude, a variogram model is used at a 30 km grid scale. The study fits the snowline altitude with variables like latitude, longitude, and altitude, and explores the impact of climatic factors such as temperature, precipitation, and radiation on the spatial differences in snowline altitude, quantitatively analyzing its dominant factors.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了分析雪线高度的空间异质性，研究在30公里网格尺度上使用变异函数模型。研究将雪线高度与纬度、经度和海拔等变量进行拟合，并探讨气候因素如温度、降水和辐射对雪线高度空间差异的影响，定量分析其主导因素。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What role does the integration of climatic factors play in determining the spatial heterogeneity of snowline altitude in mountainous areas?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 气候因素的整合在确定山区雪线高度的空间异质性中发挥了什么作用？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of climatic factors such as temperature, precipitation, and radiation plays a significant role in determining the spatial heterogeneity of snowline altitude by impacting the interannual variation and dominant factors affecting snowline altitude. For instance, summer mean air temperature is identified as the dominant factor affecting snowline altitude in High Mountain Asia.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 气候因素如温度、降水和辐射的综合作用在决定雪线高度的空间异质性方面发挥着重要作用，因为它们影响着年际变化和影响雪线高度的主导因素。例如，夏季平均气温被认为是影响高山亚洲雪线高度的主导因素。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the data collection methods used for determining snowline altitude in high-altitude regions and suggest enhancements to improve data accuracy and reliability.
